member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Design.Internal.ForwardingProxy`1
member.summary: This is a small piece of Remoting magic. It enables us to invoke methods on a remote object without knowing its actual type. The only restriction is that the names and shapes of the types and their members must be the same on each side of the boundary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Design.Internal.ForwardingProxy`1.Invoke(System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage)
member.summary: Intercepts method invocations on the object represented by the current instance and forwards them to the target to finish processing.

member.summary: The name '{migrationName}' is used by an existing migration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Internal.CommandsStrings.MultipleContexts

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Internal.CommandsStrings.MultipleContextsWithName(System.Object)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Internal.CommandsStrings.MultipleContextsWithQualifiedName(System.Object)
member.summary: More than one DbContext named '{name}' was found. Specify which one to use by providing its fully qualified name using its exact case.

member.summary: The migration '{name}' has already been applied to the database. Unapply it and try again. If the migration has been applied to other databases, consider reverting its changes using a new migration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Internal.CommandsStrings.UnknownOperation(System.Object)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Internal.CommandsStrings.UnknownLiteral(System.Object)
member.summary: The current CSharpHelper cannot scaffold literals of type '{literalType}'. Configure your services to use one that can.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Entity.Internal.CommandsStrings.ForeignMigrations(System.Object)
member.summary: The namespace '{migrationsNamespace}' contains migrations for a different DbContext. This can result in conflicting migration names. It's reccommend to put migrations for different DbContext classes into different namespaces.
